qas.question: Who was the first confederate soldier to be killed in the civil war?
What battle did Private Henry Wyatt die in?

answers.text: in the Battle of Big Bethel

qas.question: When was the battle of Gettysburg?

context: The first Confederate soldier to be killed in the Civil War was <a0_0>Private Henry Wyatt<a0_0/> from <a1_0>North Carolina<a1_0/>, <a2_0>in the Battle of Big Bethel<a2_0/> in <a3_0>June 1861<a3_0/>. At the Battle of Gettysburg in <a4_0>July 1863<a4_0/>, the 26th North Carolina Regiment participated in Pickett/Pettigrew's Charge and advanced the farthest into the Northern lines of any Confederate regiment. During the Battle of Chickamauga, the 58th North Carolina Regiment advanced farther than any other regiment on Snodgrass Hill to push back the remaining Union forces from the battlefield. At Appomattox Court House in Virginia in April 1865, the 75th North Carolina Regiment, a cavalry unit, fired the last shots of the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia in the Civil War. For many years, North Carolinians proudly boasted that they had been "First at Bethel, Farthest at Gettysburg and Chickamauga, and Last at Appomattox."
